title: Thunderbird abbrviating new groups
creator: steve.barton
content:
Thunderbird by default abreviates new groups, which makes our review news groups unintelligible. This has been dealt with before, but solutions are not working for me on the newest Thunderbird. Alternative solution :

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/config-editor

I can change the setting mail.server.default.abbreviate, but it does not change the display without a reset. After a reset the setting is back to true.

The link mentions saving the setting with a tick box, but I cannot see a tick box.

Please advise. Thanks, Steve.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:127.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/127.0

title: URL miss spelling at Downloading Thunderbird

content:
Please be advised that when I tried to download Thunderbird program using following URL, I got "404 Not Found" Error. URL has miss spelling "ja" should be "Ja-JP-mac". https://www.thunderbird.net/ja/download/

（Wrong） https://download-installer.cdn.mozilla.net/pub/thunderbird/releases/128.4.3esr/mac/ja/Thunderbird%20128.4.3esr.dmg

（Right） https://download-installer.cdn.mozilla.net/pub/thunderbird/releases/128.4.3esr/mac/Ja-JP-mac/Thunderbird%20128.4.3esr.dmg

Good day!

content:
Good afternoon.

I will describe the problem step by step. There is a mail server. It has a web version of mail (SOGo). Created an account for the meeting room. title: Gmail "All Mail" folder location missing
creator: William_H
content:
I have two mail accounts, both handled as IMAP in Thunderbird. An (Microsoft) Outlook one, and a Googe Gmail one. With both I have a "All Mail" folder. On Outlook this isn't common to have a folder like that, but I created myself a search folder and it performs like the you would expect at Gmail, showing all emails delivered to the Outlook account.

On both accounts I have activated the row "Location" in the "All Mail" folder. That way I can see what the location is of the emails. With the Outlook account this works perfectly, showing in Thunderbird the location of every email in the "All Mail" folder. With the Gmail account this doesn't work as expected, and it shows the location "All mail". Although when I look in the webmail of Gmail, and if you check the "All mail" folder over there, it nicely gives the location of every email in that folder. So it is possible.

Does anybody know why at my Gmail account the wrong location in shown and in the webmail it shows it correctly?

(see attachments for what I mean)

title: Thunderbird Reiniciando Sempre - Impossível Usar
creator: ivensmg
content: Ao marcar como lida a última mensagem (mais antiga) da caixa de entrada da conta principal, o Thunderbird passou a reiniciar. Eu o abri novamente e deu tempo de marcá-la como não lida e assim deixei durante meses, embora aquilo me incomodasse. Não era possível marcá-la, selecioná-la ou deletá-la (a citada mensagem). Então tentei selecionar TODAS e marcar TODAS como lidas, daí em diante nunca mais consegui utilizar o Thunderbird, ele entra, fica alguns segundos e em seguida reinicia - e dá a tela de crash. Enviei vários relatórios descrevendo o problema, mas já desisti de escrever tudo toda vez. Então resolvi apelar à comunidade e aos desenvolvedores. Não há imagens que ilustrem o problema.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0

content: When trying to send an email I get this error message: We're sorry, but we can't send your email. title: Linux/XFCE, full-hd notebook, incorrect font sizes in received HTML e-mails
creator: marka.konto.prywatne
content:
I'm using a X13 ThinkPad with 1920x1080 resolution on a 13'3 display with Linux (Arch) and XFCE desktop. For the best results I've increased the XFCE's DPI to 134 and fonts sizes to 10. It looks like the fonts of the size ~13 without DPI change. It's fine, and applications like Firefox like those settings.

In Thunderbird I've set the font size (interface) to 12 and in Settings the default font sizes for Latin and Other Writing Systems to 12 (both) and finally the interface font as well as plain text email and HTML e-mails without font sizes specified explicitly look natively and perfectly.

But there are some senders using clients that generate HTML e-mails and specify the font explicitly as 'font-size=12pt' in their body by default. The same as my 12 so everything should be fine. Unfortunately font in those e-mails is really HUUUUGE! I'm wondering if there is some setting that allows custom scaling but only the HTML messages. Or some pt to px custom scaling for HTML? Or some maximal size allowed in HTML?

title: email access to a problem account
creator: jetmayor
content:
I have an email account on Thunderbird (jetmayor@gmail.com). I can get to this account on one laptop but not on my other newer laptop. The screen asks me to sign in and shows my email address as above. Underneath the shown email address it says 'Forgot email?' Underneath this it says: Before using this app, you can review Mozilla Thunderbird Email’s privacy policy and terms of service. Create Account NEXT

Whatever I press it goes to another screen and says: 400. That’s an error. The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know.

The email address did work OK for months and I just don't know how to get it back. I've tried to delete the account and then reinstall it but that hasn't worked. My other email addresses are still working fine. I can still access the faulty address directly on Google Mail so I know it still should work. It's possible I have changed the password in the google account. I have tried this password in Thunderbird but to no effect. Is there a way to reinstall the faulty address? Help! Any help would be greatly appreciated.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0

title: Moving emails between folders
creator: Petermoran
content:
Hi I'm running version 128.4.3esr.

To prevent my inbox becoming very large I have created a folder called Archive and several subfolders such as 2021, 2022, 2023 etc.

Every few months I move old files from an earlier year into its appropriate subfolders.

I've been doing this for at least 10 years. When a folder is about 5 years old it is deleted.

My problem is that today I'm unable to move emails from my inbox to an appropriate subfolder. I get no response. It simply doesn't work as it used to.

Any suggestions gratefully accepted

Peter Moran

title: Thunderbird 128.2.3esr (64-bit) Sending of username did not succeed. Mail server responded: invalid command
creator: bucees
content:
Hi your all,

I have used Thurderbird more than 6 years and it was really good for me without any complaints. However, I updated the email from Supernova to Nebular (128.2.3esr (64-bit) yesterday and I got the following message and I cannot receive any emails now. Fortunately, sending is no problem.

"Sending of username did not succeed. Mail server pop3.mailplug.co.kr responded: invalid command"

I searched the previous similar issues in the forum and I checked my status. However my own was the right one that people recommend.

Receiving Server: pop3.mailplug.co.kr / Port: 995 / SSL/TLS / Normal password Sending Server: smtp.mailplug.co.kr / Port: 465 / SSL/TLS / Normal password

Actually, I am using several pop email apps but I have no any issues on those apps except for the Thunderbird. The problem is Thunderbird is my main app. I am alternatively using outlook but really want to return to Thunderbird. Could you anyone help me out?

Thank you for your kindness in advance!
